CapInfo.Description: This function is used to retrieve capsule related information.
CapInfo.Name: CapInfo

CmpUserLevel.Description: This function provides the current user Level , i.e, “Owner” Or  “Data  Entry” depends on the Security control.
CmpUserLevel.Name: CmpUserLevel

CmpUserName.Description: This function returns the Tally Vault user name.
CmpUserName.Name: CmpUserName

COMExecute.Description: This function is used to invoke the defined COM Interface. It can invoke Interfaces with only IN Parameters.
COMExecute.Name: COMExecute

ContainDirectories.Description: This function is used to check whether the directory path contains sub (directories) folders or not.
ContainDirectories.Name: ContainDirectories

CurrentCompany.Description: This function is used to refer to the name of the company which has been currently loaded. This function does not accept any parameter and returns the company name as result.
CurrentCompany.Name: CurrentCompany

CurrentDate.Description: This function is used to pick up the Current Date set in Tally. This does not accept any parameter and returns a value of type Date.
CurrentDate.Name: CurrentDate

CurrentPeriodFrom.Description: The above function is used Display the Starting Date of the Current financial Period. It does not take any parameters but returns a value of type Date.
CurrentPeriodFrom.Name: CurrentPeriodFrom

CurrentPeriodTo.Description: The above function is used to display the Ending Date of the Current Period.
CurrentPeriodTo.Name: CurrentPeriodTo

CurrentSimpleCompany.Description: This function returns the current simple company Name, which is not a group company.In case of this function is called in a Group company,  it returns first simple company under that.
CurrentSimpleCompany.Name: CurrentSimpleCompany

DebugLog.Description: This function is used to log all the parsing evaluation done when tally is run in DevMode. The expression evaluation results can be viewed in tally working directory with the excel filename starting with 'debug'.
DebugLog.Name: DebugLog

ExcelInfo.Description: This function is used to get the Excel 'version' and to check whether 'XLSX' format is supported.
ExcelInfo.Name: ExcelInfo

GetFileNameFromPath.Description: This function returns file name or the last directory from the specified path.
GetFileNameFromPath.Name: GetFileNameFromPath

GetParentDirectory.Description: This function returns the parent directory for specifed path.
GetParentDirectory.Name: GetParentDirectory

IsAnyCmpOwner.Description: This function checks whether the person is an administrator or not and has permission for company operations.
IsAnyCmpOwner.Name: IsAnyCmpOwner

IsCmpOwner.Description: This function checks if the person is the Administrator. Here Administrator is the person who is assigned as Admin in the Company Creation/Alteration Report Only.
IsCmpOwner.Name: IsCmpOwner

IsDirectoryExists.Description: This function allows to find if given directory exists or not.
IsDirectoryExists.Name: IsDirectoryExists

IsFileExists.Description: This function allows to find if given file exists or not.
IsFileExists.Name: IsFileExists

IsHiddenFileDir.Description: This function is used to check the directory or file is hidden or not.
IsHiddenFileDir.Name: IsHiddenFileDir

IsInternetActive.Description: This function allows to find if there is an active modem or a LAN Internet connection on the local system
IsInternetActive.Name: IsInternetActive

IsPathNetworkShared.Description: This function return True if the path provided is a Network shared.
IsPathNetworkShared.Name: IsPathNetworkShared

IsSimpleCompany.Description: This function is used to check whether the currently opened company is a Simple Company or not.
IsSimpleCompany.Name: IsSimpleCompany

MakeFTPName.Description: The function $$MakeFTPName is used for creating the file transfer protocol based on the specifications. The parameters becomes FtpServer, FtpUser, FtpPassword, FtpPath.  FTPServer is used for  specifying the server , FTPUser is for specifying the user and so on.
MakeFTPName.Name: MakeFTPName

MakeHTTPName.Description: The function $$MakeHTTPName is used for creating the Hyper Text Transfer Protocol for the specified security features.  The Syntax includes the string formula HttpUrl, HttpIsSecure, Http User Name, HttpPassword & CompanyName.
MakeHTTPName.Name: MakeHTTPName

MakeMAILName.Description: Constructs a SMTP mail to URL from various parameters for sending mail.
MakeMAILName.Name: MakeMAILName

OriginalCompany.Description: Returns the name of Original Company to which the Object Belongs. This is evaluated in the context of Primary Object available in current context
OriginalCompany.Name: OriginalCompany

ParentPeriodFrom.Description: The function $$ParentPeriodFrom is used to fetch starting date of the accounting period. It accepts no parameter and returns a date value which is present in the From date of the period.
ParentPeriodFrom.Name: ParentPeriodFrom

SetWorkingDir.Description: This function allows you to change the current working directory.
SetWorkingDir.Name: SetWorkingDir

SysInfo.Description: This function is used to retrieve system related information.
SysInfo.Name: SysInfo

SystemPeriodFrom.Description: $$SystemPeriodFrom function will give the value of the starting date of the currently selected company.
SystemPeriodFrom.Name: SystemPeriodFrom

SystemPeriodTo.Description: $$SystemPeriodTo function will give the value of the ending date of the currently selected company.
SystemPeriodTo.Name: SystemPeriodTo

ValidatePath.Description: This function is used to check whether syntax of a path is correct.
ValidatePath.Name: ValidatePath

WordInfo.Description: This function is used to get the Word 'version' supported. This can also be used to find  if Word is installed
WordInfo.Name: WordInfo
